results.title: The Lemonade stand: what's fair?
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Thomas Smith
results.brief_description: Uses the illustration of two boys who open a lemonade stand in order to present a study of the meaning of commitment, obligations, and responsibility to others. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Leith Ratten case
results.creator_credit: Murray Travers, ABC-TV (Australia) and Tristram Miall
results.brief_description: A dramatised recreation of the trial and conviction of Leith Ratten for the murder of his wife in Shepparton in 1970. Examines the events preceeding the trial and reexamines the evidence. Stars Danny Adcock and Julie Dawson.

results.title: The Legends of Malibu
results.brief_description: Relive the magic of Malibu as legendary surfers document the birth of a lifestyle, a cultural revolution based on sunshine, surfing and good vibrations. Featuring renowned surfers such as Mike Doyle, Wayne Miyata, Lance Carson, Mickey Dora, Mike Hynson and hosted by the legendary Corky Carroll, featuring music by The Beach Boys, The Surfaris and Surf Raiders.

results.title: The Legendary Rex
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The Rex Theatre, in Charlton, was built in 1938 and opened with the film ‘Mary, Queen of Scots’. David Pollard, who worked as a projectionist at the theatre since 1980, takes us on a tour of this historic theatre. He is the Chairperson of the Charlton Community Theatre and has been working towards getting The Rex into community ownership, as there is not a large population base for the theatre to be commercially viable.
The community has offered voluntary labour and raised over $80,000 and with the help of fundraising from the federal government, it is hoped the theatre will eventually be completely in the hands of the community.

results.title: The Legend of the pied piper
results.brief_description: One of a series of films in which puppets are used to interpret folk legends. This film is an adaptation of the well-known fairy story of how the master musician drove the rats from the city of Hamelin.

results.title: The Legend of the holy drinker
results.creator_credit: Cecchi Gori Group, Tiger Cinematografica, Aura Film, Roberta Cicutto, Vincenzo de Leo, Mario Cecchi Gori, Vittorio Cecchi Gori and Ermanno Olmi
results.brief_description: In this award winning Italian film based on the novel by Joseph Roth, Rutger Hauer plays Andreas, an ex-miner jailed for an accidental murder. Released from prison, he is living the life of an alcoholic derelict, under the bridges of Paris until he comes into contact with a stranger, who gives him 200 francs. Andreas is confident of finding work and insists that the money should be a loan only. The stranger asks that he repay the debt to the local parish priest, as soon as he is in a position to do so. Despite Andreas’ good intentions, he is continually caught up with events or old acquaintances that part him from his money, yet strangely, the 200 francs keeps reappearing back in his wallet. Cast also includes Anthony Quayle, Sandrine Dumas, Sophie Segalen and Dominique Pinon.

results.title: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, David Adams, Nick Bosustow and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: Visualizes the spectral spirits and twilight superstitions that haunted the drowsy Dutch settlement of Sleepy Hollow. Concerns the rivalry between Ichabod Crane and Brom Bones for the hand of Katrina Van Tassel, and how the Headless Horseman of Sleepy Hollow removes Ichabod from the scene. Screenplay by Joseph Cavella, based on the story by Washington Irving. Narrated by John Carradine.

results.title: The Legend of Robin Hood: black arrow
results.creator_credit: Walter J Hucker and Air Programs International
results.brief_description: Introduced by John-Michael Howson, this tape includes two tales for the family to enjoy. “The Legend of Robin Hood”; King Richard leaves for England to crusade in the Holy Land. He leaves the kingdom in the hands of his brother, Prince John. All does not go well however, and Prince John and his Barons use the power recently invested in them to increase their estates at the expense of the citizens. Only one citizen dares to protest against their shoddy behaviour; Robin of Locksley, who becomes an outlaw and adopts the name, Robin Hood. Directed by Zoran Janic. “Black arrow”; Squire Richard Shelton, heir to the Turnstall Estate sets out to join the Lancastrian Army. On his way he meets the mysterious brotherhood of the Black Arrow and discovers startling news. His guardian, Sir Daniel Brackley, is plotting to steal his estate and may have been involved in the death of Richard’s father. Directed by Leif Gram.

results.title: The Legend of Mark Twain
results.creator_credit: Daniel Wilson, Jules Power Productions, Benchmark Films and Karl Genus
results.brief_description: Follows Samuel Clemens’ life and career on the American literary scene and dramatises selections from two of his well-known classics - “The Celebrated jumping frog of Calaveras County” and “The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn”. Cast includes David Wayne.
